Uses of Interface
CollidingObject

  • Uses of CollidingObject in <Unnamed>

    Subinterfaces of CollidingObject in <Unnamed>
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    interface  SolidCollider
    Interface to be implemented by any object that must not allow an object to pass through it
    This interface extends CollidingObject, so you only need to implement this one.

    In the constructor
    Classes in <Unnamed> that implement CollidingObject
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  ExampleKeyListener  
    class  ExampleMouseListener  
    Fields in <Unnamed> with type parameters of type CollidingObject
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.util.LinkedList<CollidingObject> CollidingObject.colliders
    A LinkedList maintaining all classes implementing CollidingObject
    (all objects that could collide with each other)
    Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type CollidingObject
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void CollidingObject.addCollider​(CollidingObject object)
    Adds a CollidingObject to the colliders list.
    Should be called in the constructor of a class implementing CollidingObject
    static void CollidingObject.getCollisions​(CollidingObject object)
    Checks for bounding box collisions between a given object and all other CollidingObject classes
    Calls the object's collision handler with a list of CollidingObject classes with which it intersects
    static boolean SolidCollider.willCauseSolidCollision​(CollidingObject o, int vel, boolean xAxis)
    Determines if a given movement along a single axis will cause a collision with a solid object
    Should be used to determine if a given movement can be performed e.g.
    Method parameters in <Unnamed> with type arguments of type CollidingObject
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void CollidingObject.handleCollisions​(java.util.LinkedList<CollidingObject> collisions)
    A required function for all classes extending CollidingObject.
    This is called when a collision is detected on a given object
    void ExampleKeyListener.handleCollisions​(java.util.LinkedList<CollidingObject> collisions)  
    void ExampleMouseListener.handleCollisions​(java.util.LinkedList<CollidingObject> collisions)
